meaningMnemonic: If it’s a <kanji>steam</kanji>ing <kanji>hot</kanji> day, it means the weather is <vocabulary>hot and humid</vocabulary> (or you can just say <vocabulary>humid</vocabulary>, because that usually implies hotness too). This is a useful word for summers in Japan, since you'll complain about this all the time.
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 蒸れる and 暑い. Know those and you know this too.
